## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install porter on a linux by using this script: https://cdn.porter.sh/latest/install-linux.sh
2. See that the same porter binary exists in $PORTER_HOME/porter and $PORTER_HOME/runtimes/porter-runtime

## Expected behavior

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Retrofitted the api-app app config so that it uses these key vault secrets rather than clear text values.
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above) 
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above)
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.

- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above)
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above)
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above)
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above)
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

**Describe the bug**
After using guacamole for a long period of time get:

`jwt.exceptions.ExpiredSignatureError: Signature has expired`

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Connect to a VM via Apache Guacamole.
2. Leave connection open for long period of time - 24hrs, then refresh the page.
3. Unable to access the VM. Even if refresh the page still unable to access the VM.

As a Azure TRE Developer 
I want to pass the access token to the underlying API
So that the authentication is according to best practices

on top of that, if needed, refresh tokens support may be added (today they are not supported) - Issue #1110 .

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] id token is received at first
- [ ] id token is validated, only continue if token itself is valid + all required scopes/aud/etc is valid and matching (exists today)
- [ ] only if validated. an access token is requested (whether via OBO flow, code flow or other - need to choose best suitable)
- [ ] access token is sent to the TRE API
- [ ] if needed, fix TRE API to support the new token (probably not needed)


Technical notes:
1. Today we are using the [openid extension](https://guacamole.apache.org/doc/gug/openid-auth.html) which is using the [implicit grant flow](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-implicit-grant-flow) to provide an id_token
2. the open id extension is loading first (either configuration or alphabetically)
3. redirected back to guacamole with the id_token
4. Can't use another implicit grant to get the access token as it will create an infinite loop. on top of that, implicit grant [can't be used to refresh token](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-implicit-grant-flow#refreshing-tokens) and also are not supported for browsers with [3rd party cookies blocked](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/v2-oauth2-implicit-grant-flow#prefer-the-auth-code-flow)
5. Need to see if the openid extension can be used with [OBO flow](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/msal-authentication-flows#on-behalf-of)
6. another option is to avoid using the openid extension and implement the complete flow
7. Last point, need to verify that without issuing refresh token, guacamole does disconnect after a period of time

'merged_at': None}, 'body': "# PR for issue #220

## What is being addressed

This PR places the credentials for the API into the core KeyVault so that the Resource Provider can read them so that it can communicate with the Auth tenant. This is part 1 of multiple PR's

## How is this addressed

- Add 3 new secrets into KeyVault
- Add the keyvault name as an environment variable to the VMSS instance.
- Utilise a porter plugin that automatically reads from KeyVault (from the name above)
- Use a new credential set in Porter to retrieve the necessary secrets from the Vault
- #1701 will continue this work

{'action': 'created', 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/pulls/comments/851211510', 'pull_request_review_id': 942500923, 'id': 851211510, 'node_id': 'PRRC_kwDOFIjTH84yvHT2', 'diff_hunk': '@@ -0,0 +1,156 @@
+resource "azurerm_network_interface" "nexus" {
+  name                = "nic-nexus-${var.tre_id}"
+  location            = data.azurerm_resource_group.rg.location
+  resource_group_name = local.core_resource_group_name
+
+  ip_configuration {
+    name                          = "primary"
+    subnet_id                     = data.azurerm_subnet.shared.id
+    private_ip_address_allocation = "Dynamic"
+  }
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_private_dns_zone" "nexus" {
+  name                = "nexus-${var.tre_id}.${data.azurerm_resource_group.rg.location}.cloudapp.azure.com"
+  resource_group_name = local.core_resource_group_name
+
+  lifecycle { ignore_changes = [tags] }
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_private_dns_zone_virtual_network_link" "nexus_core_vnet" {
+  name                  = "nexuslink-core"
+  resource_group_name   = local.core_resource_group_name
+  private_dns_zone_name = azurerm_private_dns_zone.nexus.name
+  virtual_network_id    = data.azurerm_virtual_network.core.id
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_private_dns_a_record" "nexus_vm" {
+  name                = "@"
+  zone_name           = azurerm_private_dns_zone.nexus.name
+  resource_group_name = local.core_resource_group_name
+  ttl                 = 300
+  records             = [azurerm_linux_virtual_machine.nexus.private_ip_address]
+}
+
+resource "random_password" "nexus_vm_password" {
+  length           = 16
+  lower            = true
+  min_lower        = 1
+  upper            = true
+  min_upper        = 1
+  number           = true
+  min_numeric      = 1
+  special          = true
+  min_special      = 1
+  override_special = "_%@"
+}
+
+resource "random_password" "nexus_admin_password" {
+  length           = 16
+  lower            = true
+  min_lower        = 1
+  upper            = true
+  min_upper        = 1
+  number           = true
+  min_numeric      = 1
+  special          = true
+  min_special      = 1
+  override_special = "_%@"
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_key_vault_secret" "nexus_vm_password" {
+  name         = "nexus-vm-password"
+  value        = random_password.nexus_vm_password.result
+  key_vault_id = data.azurerm_key_vault.kv.id
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_key_vault_secret" "nexus_admin_password" {
+  name         = "nexus-admin-password"
+  value        = random_password.nexus_admin_password.result
+  key_vault_id = data.azurerm_key_vault.kv.id
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_user_assigned_identity" "nexus_msi" {
+  name                = "id-nexus-${var.tre_id}"
+  location            = data.azurerm_resource_group.rg.location
+  resource_group_name = local.core_resource_group_name
+  lifecycle { ignore_changes = [tags] }
+}
+
+resource "azurerm_role_assignment" "kv_reader" {
+  scope                = data.azurerm_key_vault.kv.id
+  role_definition_name = "Key Vault Reader"
+  principal_id         = azurerm_user_assigned_identity.nexus_msi.principal_id

issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update

+FROM debian:stretch-slim
+
+ARG BUNDLE_DIR
+
+RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y ca-certificates
+
+# Install Azure CLI
+RUN apt-get update \
+    && apt-get install -y ca-certificates jq curl apt-transport-https lsb-release gnupg \
+    && curl -sL https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | gpg --dearmor | tee /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/microsoft.gpg > /dev/null \

+    && echo "deb [arch=amd64] https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/azure-cli/ $AZ_REPO main" | tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/azure-cli.list \

issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': +---
+#cloud-config
+package_upgrade: true
+apt:
+  sources:
+    docker.list:
+      source: deb [arch=amd64]
+        https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $RELEASE stable
+      keyid: 9DC858229FC7DD38854AE2D88D81803C0EBFCD88
+      keyserver: hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80
+    azure-cli.list:
+      source: deb [arch=amd64]
+        https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/azure-cli/ $RELEASE main
+      keyid: BC528686B50D79E339D3721CEB3E94ADBE1229CF
+      keyserver: hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80
+
+packages:
+  - docker-ce
+  - docker-ce-cli
+  - containerd.io
+  - docker-compose
+  - gnupg2
+  - pass
+  - azure-cli
+  - default-jre
+  - xmlstarlet
+
+# create the docker group
+groups:
+  - docker
+
+# Add default auto created user to docker group
+system_info:
+  default_user:
+    groups: [docker]
+
+write_files:
+  - path: /etc/cron.hourly/docker-prune
+    # An hourly cron job to have docker free disk space. Running this frquently
+    # since disk might get full fast, but we prune only when free space is low.
+    content: |
+      #!/bin/bash
+      set -o errexit
+      used_percent=$(df / --output=pcent | tail -1 | sed 's/[^0-9]//g')
+      echo "Used disk space percent: $${used_percent}"
+      if (( used_percent > 60 )); then
+        echo "Free space too low, pruning..."
+        docker system prune -f
+      fi
+    permissions: '0755'
+
+  - path: /etc/cron.daily/renew-nexus-cert
+    # Daily cron job to renew nexus cert based on certificate present in keyvault
+    content: |
+      #!/bin/bash
+      set -o errexit
+      echo "Calling configure-nexus-ssl script to renew ssl certificate"
+      bash /home/adminuser/configure-nexus-ssl.sh
+    permissions: '0755'
+
+  # Configure Nexus to disable default repos
+  - path: /etc/nexus-data/etc/nexus.properties
+    content: |
+      nexus.skipDefaultRepositories=true
+    permissions: '0755'
+
+  # Set up Nexus to serve https using SSL cert
+  - path: /home/adminuser/configure-nexus-ssl.sh
+    content: |

issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata

issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': {'action': 'created', 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/pulls/comments/850614029', 'pull_request_review_id': 942500923, 'id': 850614029, 'node_id': 'PRRC_kwDOFIjTH84ys1cN', 'diff_hunk': '@@ -0,0 +1,186 @@
+---
+#cloud-config
+package_upgrade: true
+apt:
+  sources:
+    docker.list:
+      source: deb [arch=amd64]
+        https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $RELEASE stable
+      keyid: 9DC858229FC7DD38854AE2D88D81803C0EBFCD88
+      keyserver: hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80
+    azure-cli.list:
+      source: deb [arch=amd64]
+        https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/azure-cli/ $RELEASE main
+      keyid: BC528686B50D79E339D3721CEB3E94ADBE1229CF
+      keyserver: hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80
+
+packages:
+  - docker-ce
+  - docker-ce-cli
+  - containerd.io
+  - docker-compose
+  - gnupg2
+  - pass
+  - azure-cli
+  - default-jre
+  - xmlstarlet
+
+# create the docker group
+groups:
+  - docker
+
+# Add default auto created user to docker group
+system_info:
+  default_user:
+    groups: [docker]
+
+write_files:
+  - path: /etc/cron.hourly/docker-prune
+    # An hourly cron job to have docker free disk space. Running this frquently
+    # since disk might get full fast, but we prune only when free space is low.
+    content: |
+      #!/bin/bash
+      set -o errexit
+      used_percent=$(df / --output=pcent | tail -1 | sed 's/[^0-9]//g')
+      echo "Used disk space percent: $${used_percent}"
+      if (( used_percent > 60 )); then
+        echo "Free space too low, pruning..."
+        docker system prune -f
+      fi

issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata

issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/jjgriff93/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'body': '# PR for issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/jjgriff93/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'body': '# PR for issue

## What is being addressed

In order to enable #1089 and proxy Docker Hub, we need to be able to map multiple ports to the Nexus docker container so that Docker hub can have its dedicated port. This means that we need to move away from App Service which limits us to only being able to map one custom port and instead host Nexus on a VM to give us the flexibility we require.

## How is this addressed

- Removed App Service TF
- Added Nexus VM definition 
- Initialise Nexus container with cloud-init startup script
- Rewrote nexus properties config and admin password reset scripts
- Added private DNS zone and vnet linking to allow connectivity to Nexus Vm from core and workspace vnets using DNS name
- Integrated lets encrypt SSL cert as part of cloudinit bootstrapping, placing it in nexus keystone and configuring Nexus Jetty instance to consume cert and handle traffic via SSL

Merged in #1480 to enable SSL cert integration so that user resources can access secure proxy without any additional configuration.

Fixes #1609

### Update
Need to add 
- [x] caching to the PR/Main builds to prevent lets encrypt blacklisting (repeated challenge attempts instead of reading letsencrypt local metadata 
- [x] CRON job in Nexus VM to renew certificate on daily basis', 'created_at': '2022-03-24T00:36:29Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-19T04:44:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': is being addressed Since openid extension only returned the token_id and we needed the access token, we are changing the way we authenticate: use oauth2 proxy instead of the guacamole open id extension. This also fix the issue of not supporting refresh tokens as the proxy handles this ## How is this addressed - add a service to the tomcat server that starts up the oauth2-proxy - This service is the new entry point to the web app - proxy listens on 8085 port and redirect traffic after its being authenticated - our custom guacamole extension gets the token as a request header and pass it if needed to the underlying api - extra: upgraded guacamole to 1.4.0 ## Why is this a **_draft_** PR? -- UPDATED -- - [x] tests are not finished - Decided to do in the next iteration - [x] port is 8085 but it should be 8080 -Decided to leave it like that - [x] need to validate the refresh token more thoroughly (tested manually over 9 hours with an open session) - [x] option to consider: not using tomcat server and build another docker file that hosts the needed processes - decided not to go on with that option. - [x] vm list is not updated without logging out and in (regression) - will be handled 'COLLABORATOR', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "## Description

As a TRE Developer I want to be notified if I try to run /tests on a PR that includes workflow changes so that I have expected results.
The PR Bot (running /test command) always uses the definition from the main branch so if a PR changes workflows it won't actually test those.

## Acceptance criteria

- /test is prevented from running on PR with workflow changes
- A user is notifies who to progress", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1690/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1690/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1662.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1662.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1662/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'body': '## Description

As a TRE Administrator, I want to know the status of my TRE solution so that I can address potential issues with its components.
As an App Gateway, I want to know if the API is healthy so that I can forward it requests.

The current use of the API health endpoint to do both is causing issues and we need to figure out what requirements are important for us and how to address them.

## Acceptance criteria

automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-11T09:54:33Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-11T09:54:33Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-11T09:54:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-11T09:54:27Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-11T08:12:59Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-10T14:02:18Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. All items below results in almost 300MB reduction in size: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being installed as well ', 'created_at': '2022-04-07T16:38:37Z', 'updated_at': '2022-04-10T14:02:18Z', 'closed_at': None, 'merged_at': None, 'merge_commit_sha': 'body': '## Description

As a TRE Administrator, I want to know the status of my TRE solution so that I can address potential issues with its components.
As an App Gateway, I want to know if the API is healthy so that I can forward it requests.

The current use of the API health endpoint to do both is causing issues and we need to figure out what requirements are important for us and how to address them.

default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. Results are: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use '2022-04-10T07:34:45Z', 'closed_at': None, 'author_association': 'COLLABORATOR', 'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': '**Describe the bug**

Most of our bash scripts don't sent common switches important to avoid unintended behaviors. Specifically many don't use `set -o nounset` which don't catch misspelled / not provided variables.
When this is added to certain scripts, it has a cascade affect on scripts that don't use it as we chain commands in our make targets (command1 && command2).

**Steps to reproduce**
- `make build-api-image` never used the "CI ACR" as the image name was using a non existing var visible [here](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/blob/main/Makefile#L64).
The log example from one of the runs (pr bot):
#11 importing cache manifest from ***.azurecr.io/:0.2.12
#11 sha256:2fe49dad347b96f3d494163154bea9c19f4825505b5ac4478c0d055bc36f9996
#11 ERROR: invalid reference format

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1662.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1662.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': 'Fixes #1661 ## What is being addressed Porter default install script adds things we don't need which increases the devcontainer size. Results are: ## How is this addressed - "manually" install porter and the mixins we need - Use a symlink to avoid copying the porter binary twice (as the automated script does) - All `apt-get install` run commands end with a cleanup procedure - Added an INTERACTIVE argument to control installing additional tools that are needed for a developer but not in CI - All `pip install` commands use `--no-cache-dir` to save space - Remove azfirewall extension as a dependency as it's not needed in most cases and scripts install it on demand - Make sure the e2e python dependencies are being 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1597.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': '# PR for issue

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1556 

## How is this addressed

- [x] Made changes to the script [register_bundle_with_api.sh](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/compare/tborisova/1556-build-shared-services-as-part-of-the-build?expand=1#diff-f1a4a282ce8199af220677f924428ac8e1c97e589452ebd383f9d1c9bf601e01) to register shared services and also optionally deploy shared services
- [x] Add `make` targets for building, registering and deploying shared services
- [x] Made changes to Porter bundles to make them deployable (e.g. template_schema.json was missing in some)
- [x] Pass location from resource processor to porter bundles as several bundles depend on it 
- [x] Manually test e2e in an environment

The last 4 runs failed with the same error (permission denied when trying to connect to Docker socket from the build agent): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52954123/161593093-0b9c1c11-dd56-4e95-8301-a16c7ab02a9b.png) This doesn't seem to be related to the PR, but doesn't look like a flake either. I wouldn't like to merge it without succeeding in CI first, since the changes to deployment are significant, would like to make sure it doesn't break CI for anybody else.

I don't know exactly why it happens but might be related to running porter and then trying to run another docker based action. I tested it on a side branch and was able to replicate it easily so merging it like so would mean that all CI validation would be fail going forward.
On the positive side, I suggest to split the shared services deployment activities into a publish step and a register/deploy step much like we do with the other bundles. This accomplishes 2 things:
1. It makes the pipeline complete successfully. An example run: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/actions/runs/2092453109
2. It reduces the total run time, as publishing (and building) the bundles runs in parallel to the deploy-core steps
The change is here: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/commit/215af780502ea6689da224a82ab902deeee498a0", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/comments/1088292565/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

'merged_at': '2022-04-03T11:42:39Z'}, 'body': 'Fixes #1526 

## What is being addressed

Storage share fails to be deleted when the resource processor uninstall a workspace.

## How is this addressed

- Package all networking resources in the base workspace as a module to be able to easily depend on all of it
- Private endpoints depend on the module
- Increase service bus max message size for the deployment status to cope with larger messages usually returned on errors

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1556 

## How is this addressed

- [x] Made changes to the script [register_bundle_with_api.sh](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/compare/tborisova/1556-build-shared-services-as-part-of-the-build?expand=1#diff-f1a4a282ce8199af220677f924428ac8e1c97e589452ebd383f9d1c9bf601e01) to register shared services and also optionally deploy shared services
- [x] Add `make` targets for building, registering and deploying shared services
- [x] Made changes to Porter bundles to make them deployable (e.g. template_schema.json was missing in some)
- [x] Pass location from resource processor to porter bundles as several bundles depend on it 
- [x] Manually test e2e in an environment

When trying to delete a (base) workspace instance, the action might fail due to a problem removing the storage share:

shares.Client#Delete: Failure sending request: StatusCode=0 -- Original Error: Delete "https://stgws84a2.file.core.windows.net/vm-shared-storage?restype=share": EOF

> True deleting_failed aad1d169-e124-43ed-859a-07b0cdbb84a2: Error context message = ‚ï∑ ‚îÇ Error: deleting File Share "vm-shared-storage" (Storage Account "stgws84a2" / Resource Group "rg-***-ws-84a2"): shares.Client#Delete: Failure sending request: StatusCode=0 -- Original Error: Delete "https://stgws84a2.file.core.windows.net/vm-shared-storage?restype=share": EOF ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚ïµ Error: error running command /cnab/app/terraform terraform destroy -auto-approve -input=false -var address_space=10.0.68.0/24 -var location=*** -var shared_storage_quota=50 -var tre_id=*** -var tre_resource_id=aad1d169-e124-43ed-859a-07b0cdbb84a2: exit status 1 Error: mixin execution failed: exit status 1 Error: 1 error occurred: 	* container exit code: 1, message: <nil>   az login --identity -u 4c1a5d14-72a0-433f-b96b-4d96d3a6e6df && az acr login --name *** && porter uninstall "aad1d169-e124-43ed-859a-07b0cdbb84a2"  --reference ***.azurecr.io/tre-workspace-base:v0.1.10  --param address_space="10.0.68.0/24" --param arm_use_msi="true" --param azure_location="***" --param id="aad1d169-e124-43ed-859a-07b0cdbb84a2" --param tfstate_container_name="tfstate" --param tfstate_resource_group_name="***mgmt" --param tfstate_storage_account_name="***state" --param tre_id="***" --cred ./vmss_porter/azure.json --allow-docker-host-access --force && porter show aad1d169-e124-43ed-859a-07b0cdbb84a2

**Steps to reproduce**

1. More likely to happen after we merge to main, but not every time

## What is being addressed

Storage share fails to be deleted when the resource processor uninstall a workspace.

## How is this addressed

- Package all networking resources in the base workspace as a module to be able to easily depend on all of it
- Private endpoints depend on the module
- Increase service bus max message size for the deployment status to cope with larger messages usually returned on errors

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1640.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1640.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': 'Fixes #1526 

## What is being addressed

Storage share fails to be deleted when the resource processor uninstall a workspace.

## How is this addressed

- Package all networking resources in the base workspace as a module to be able to easily depend on all of it
- Private endpoints depend on the module
- Increase service bus max message size for the deployment status to cope with larger messages usually returned on errors

- double escape special chars - `\n` -> `\\n`
- add shell type header `#!/bin/bash`

- run container command action - most inputs need to be optional since they are not always passed in

Following the addition of GitHub Actions linter we should make some fixes.

## How is this addressed

- run container command action - most inputs need to be optional since they are not always passed in
- disable yamllint rule for the "on" key as it's not valid
- double quotes for all vars in run steps (this need to happen for regular bash script in *.sh files but it was too much for me - need proper testing)', 'reactions': {'url': 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1636.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': '# PR for issue

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1635

## What is being addressed

This PR has been split from https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1597  and addresses the problem of deploying Firewall from Resource Processor.

Currently, Firewall is being deployed separately from the rules. Firewall [denies all traffic by default](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/firewall/rule-processing). This means that when Firewall shared service is deployed from the Resource Processor as a Porter bundle, immediately after deployment Resource Processor loses all access to internet (including Terraform servers) and cannot finish the deployment of Firewall rules (which would have opened up this traffic. 
To solve this problem, a Firewall policy containing the rules is created first. Then, when deploying Firewall, this policy is referenced which means that Resource Processor never loses access to Terraform. 

### Note on pricing

[No Azure Firewall Manager policy charges will be done for policies that are associated to a single firewall.](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/pricing/details/firewall-manager/)

## How is this addressed

- Firewall policy is created in Firewall module
- Rule priorities have been changed: priority of Application rules [has to be higher](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/firewall/rule-processing#network-rules-and-applications-rules) in the policy than priority of Network rules, otherwise Terraform complains. As such, rules are ordered so that network rules go first. Network rules also start from 200 and application from 300, as per [convention](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/firewall/policy-rule-sets#rule-collection-groups)', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1636/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1636/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/comments/1084062875', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1636#issuecomment-1084062875', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1636', 'id': 1084062875, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOFIjTH85AnXyb', 'user': {'login': 'tamirkamara', 'id': 26870601, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjI2ODcwNjAx', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/26870601?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/tamirkamara', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-03-31T04:31:21Z', 'updated_at': '2022-03-31T04:31:21Z', 'author_association': 'COLLABORATOR', 'body': 'Nice progress resolving this problem. We have many bash files with substantial logic, but we don't lint them. We also don't lint Terraform files for a few months ever since SuperLinter changed the flag name...

## How is this addressed

- Update the TF flag name
- Add more linters: bash, bash-exec (.sh files need to be executable), github actions
- Update line length for yaml files to 120 and have it apply for the linter as well (unfortunately it has to be in 2 places)
- Remove RUN_LOCAL flag which makes this lint ONLY changed files (compared to main)
- Use the slim version of SuperLinter
- Have a make target that runs SuperLinter locally.

A child PR is opened for linting fixes to make it easier to understand the changes: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1627

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1626.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1626.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "## What is being addressed

We have many bash files with substantial logic, but we don't lint them. We also don't lint Terraform files for a few months ever since SuperLinter changed the flag name...

## How is this addressed

- Update the TF flag name
- Add more linters: bash, bash-exec (.sh files need to be executable), github actions
- Update line length for yaml files to 120 and have it apply for the linter as well (unfortunately it has to be in 2 places)
- Remove RUN_LOCAL flag which makes this lint ONLY changed files (compared to main)
- Use the slim version of SuperLinter
- Have a make target that runs SuperLinter locally.

A child PR is opened for linting fixes to make it easier to understand the changes: https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1627

'active_lock_reason': None, 'body': "**Describe the bug**
When OpenCensus fails inside the Resource Processor, the main process stays healthy but stops processing messages from the Service Bus Queue.
The only way around the issue is to restart the RP container (or reimage the VM).

**Steps to reproduce**
I don't know how to exactly replicate the situation but it's common in the environment representing the main branch.
Possible, when many messages are queued for application insights and/or too large messages.", 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1628/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1628/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

We have many bash files with substantial logic, but we don't lint them. We also don't lint Terraform files for a few months ever since SuperLinter changed the flag name...

## How is this addressed

- Update the TF flag name
- Add more linters: bash, bash-exec (.sh files need to be executable), github actions
- Update line length for yaml files to 120 and have it apply for the linter as well (unfortunately it need to be in 2 places)

False}, 'body': '# PR for issue

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1556 

## How is this addressed

- [x] Made changes to the script [register_bundle_with_api.sh](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/compare/tborisova/1556-build-shared-services-as-part-of-the-build?expand=1#diff-f1a4a282ce8199af220677f924428ac8e1c97e589452ebd383f9d1c9bf601e01) to register shared services and also optionally deploy shared services
- [x] Add `make` targets for building, registering and deploying shared services
- [x] Made changes to Porter bundles to make them deployable (e.g. template_schema.json was missing in some)
- [x] Pass location from resource processor to porter bundles as several bundles depend on it 
- [x] Manually test e2e in an environment

## What is being addressed

Add the Application.ReadWrite.All permission and grant admin permission to it. This lays the work for the guacamole redirect to be updated by using the Workspace client/secret.

## How is this addressed

- new `make auth` which sets up TRE API. SwaggerUI, Automation Account and Workspace.
- Moved some of the AAD functions as a start to slim down the aad-app-reg.sh script.
- SwaggerUI app now has correct user_impersonation for api and workspace', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1600/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, There are currently 10. 

- `Build & Test` hasn't run for 6 months
- `Build Validation - Main` hasn't run for 8 months
- `Docker build and push` hasn't run for 4 months
- `Linting` hasn't run for 8 months

'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1597.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': '# PR for issue

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1556 

## How is this addressed

- [x] Made changes to the script [register_bundle_with_api.sh](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/compare/tborisova/1556-build-shared-services-as-part-of-the-build?expand=1#diff-f1a4a282ce8199af220677f924428ac8e1c97e589452ebd383f9d1c9bf601e01) to register shared services and also optionally deploy shared services
- [x] Add `make` targets for building, registering and deploying shared services
- [x] Made changes to Porter bundles to make them deployable (e.g. template_schema.json was missing in some)
- [x] Pass location from resource processor to porter bundles as several bundles depend on it 
- [x] Manually test e2e in an environment
', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1597/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'timeline_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1597/timeline', 'performed_via_github_app': None}, 'comment': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/comments/1079951158', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1597#issuecomment-1079951158', 'issue_url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/1597', 'id': 1079951158, 'node_id': 'IC_kwDOFIjTH85AXr82', 'user': {'login': 'tamirkamara', 'id': 26870601, 'node_id': 'MDQ6VXNlcjI2ODcwNjAx', 'avatar_url': 'https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/26870601?v=4', 'gravatar_id': '', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara', 'html_url': 'https://github.com/tamirkamara', 'followers_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/followers', 'following_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/following{/other_user}', 'gists_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/gists{/gist_id}', 'starred_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/starred{/owner}{/repo}', 'subscriptions_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/subscriptions', 'organizations_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/orgs', 'repos_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/repos', 'events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/events{/privacy}', 'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'created_at': '2022-03-27T15:14:11Z', 'updated_at': '2022-03-27T15:14:11Z', 'author_association': 'COLLABORATOR', 'body': 'After reviewing this on a proper screen I think we should chat about several aspects:
1. Including the "deploy" action in the flow (through the make file and register-... script) only asks the API to deploy it. There's no feedback loop that checks if the shared service has actually been deployed.
This can create issues when (for example) you call the "install" for the firewall and on the next step, try to install nexus as the firewall data terraform object might fail.
2. It doesn't work for me - I tried to deploy a new TRE and then run make firewall-install, the deployment eventually failed and rendered the system unreachable as the app gateway started to return http 502. 
Looking at the docker logs, looks like TF has crashed without completing the deployment.
3. I haven't gone through the API code, but what will happen when another make firewall-install is issued? Will it save another resource?
4. A small thing - why didn't you take the location from the core resource group as it was before this PR? You anyway depend on its name to be right, so using a data object looks fine...', 'reactions': {'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/microsoft/AzureTRE/issues/comments/1079951158/reactions', 'total_count': 0, '+1': 0, '-1': 0, 'laugh': 0, 'hooray': 0, 'confused': 0, 'heart': 0, 'rocket': 0, 'eyes': 0}, 'performed_via_github_app': None}}

**Describe the bug**
When you run :
make bundle-publish DIR=./templates/workspace_services/guacamole BUNDLE_TYPE=workspace_serv

It fails as follow : 
Starting to copy image ouhdfgaztreacr.azurecr.io/tre-service-guacamole-installer:v0.1.9...
Failed to copy image ouhadfgztreacr.azurecr.io/tre-service-guacamole-installer:v0.1.9: failed to copy: httpReaderSeeker: failed open: failed to do request: Get "https://xxxxxxxxx.blob.core.windows.net/3da852d8af114xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxykxtcpuzaw//docker/registry/v2/blobs/sha256/9a/9a7c45a3280f2ef52b0c764cd9cbf428c3240ff2866b7b6feb22eb49b5c29ad9/data?se=2022-02-28T15%3A18%3A30Z&sig=wqsQIj3kN1tv%2FU1X4xxxxxxxxxRkxeNkLkoD8vlRBUphk%3D&sp=r&spr=https&sr=b&sv=2016-05-31¬Æid=3da852d8af114c5081b4d9b2c33ada15": net/http: TLS handshake timeout
Error: error preparing the bundle with cnab-to-oci before pushing: failed to copy: httpReaderSeeker: failed open: failed to do request: Get "https://xxxxxxxxx.blob.core.windows.net/3da852d8af114c5081b4d9b2c33ada15-ykxtcpuzaw//docker/registry/v2/blobs/sha256/9a/9a7c45a3280f2ef52b0c764cd9cbf428c3240ff2866b7b6feb22eb49b5c29ad9/data?se=2022-02-28T15%3A18%3A30Z&sig=wqsQIj3kN1tv%2FU1X4hQNLrHkRkxeNkLkoD8vlRBUphk%3D&sp=r&spr=https&sr=b&sv=2016-05-31¬Æid=3da852d8af114c5081b4d9b2c33ada15": net/http: TLS handshake timeout

At first i thought it was my bad network but this was reproduced as well by another customer.


Workaround is to delete tre-service-guacamole-installer in the registry and run the command again, 2nd time it works....
Notice : if you don't delete the image it will fail again.

To Troubleshoot

## What is being addressed

The E2E got into an infinite loop when http 302 was returned

## How is this addressed

- Add 302 as a terminal status so that no retries would be attempted
- Add action timeouts so to the e2e jobs so that they will be killed if running too long. This is needed since pytest-timeout doesn't always stop the test (see the run in the mentioned issue).
- Rename some of the steps

'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Fixes #1302 

## What is being addressed

The E2E got into an infinite loop when http 302 was returned

## How is this addressed

- Add 302 as a terminal status so that no retries would be attempted
- Add action timeouts so to the e2e jobs so that they will be killed if running too long. This is needed since pytest-timeout doesn't always stop the test (see the run in the mentioned issue).
- Rename some of the steps

- [x] Made changes to the script [register_bundle_with_api.sh](https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/compare/tborisova/1556-build-shared-services-as-part-of-the-build?expand=1#diff-f1a4a282ce8199af220677f924428ac8e1c97e589452ebd383f9d1c9bf601e01) to register shared services and also optionally deploy shared services

- [x] Pass location from resource processor to porter bundles as several bundles depend on it 
- [x] Manually test e2e in an environment

The resource processor application doesn't output some of the logs. Especially, when a deployment was successful.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Ask the API to deploy a workspace 
1. Wait for it to complete successfully
1. Review the logs in the RP or AppInsights, see that entries after the "stdout" one don't really include logs of the deployment.

## What is being addressed

Resource processor should log the right output (stdout vs stderr).

## How is this addressed

- Fix the shell logging to output stdout on success
- Refactor our logging config/setup to better cope with local debugging and Application Insights
- Use a message scoped logger when one is already available
- Given the amount of testing done manually, upgrade all packages used to their latest version
- Increase the frequency of the RP pruning job as once a week isn't enough

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1548.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1548.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Fixes #1547 

## What is being addressed

Resource processor should log the right output (stdout vs stderr).

## How is this addressed

- Fix the shell logging to output stdout on success
- Refactor our logging config/setup to better cope with local debugging and Application Insights
- Use a message scoped logger when one is already available
- Given the amount of testing done manually, upgrade all packages used to their latest version
- Increase the frequency of the RP pruning job as once a week isn't enough

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Bundle image tag set to an empty string as a default which will instruct terraform to take the value from the version.txt file. If the bundle will get a value, that will be used for the image tag.
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.
- E2E tests are using the logging lib (vs. the plain print)
- Turn live_cli logs in pytest so that we'll see what is going on while the tests are running rather than waiting for it to end. Also include the timestamp of each entry.

'body': "Fixes #1581, Fixes #848 

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Bundle image tag set to an empty string as a default which will instruct terraform to take the value from the version.txt file. If the bundle will get a value, that will be used for the image tag.
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.
- E2E tests are using the logging lib (vs. the plain print)
- Turn live_cli logs in pytest so that we'll see what is going on while the tests are running rather than waiting for it to end. Also include the timestamp of each entry.

'body': "Fixes #1581, Fixes #848 

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Bundle image tag set to an empty string as a default which will instruct terraform to take the value from the version.txt file. If the bundle will get a value, that will be used for the image tag.
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.
- E2E tests are using the logging lib (vs. the plain print)
- Turn live_cli logs in pytest so that we'll see what is going on while the tests are running rather than waiting for it to end. Also include the timestamp of each entry.

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1582.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1582.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Fixes #1581, Fixes #848 

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Bundle image tag set to an empty string as a default which will instruct terraform to take the value from the version.txt file. If the bundle will get a value, that will be used for the image tag.
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.
- E2E tests are using the logging lib (vs. the plain print)
- Turn live_cli logs in pytest so that we'll see what is going on while the tests are running rather than waiting for it to end. Also include the timestamp of each entry.

'received_events_url': 'https://api.github.com/users/tamirkamara/received_events', 'type': 'User', 'site_admin': False}, 'body': "Fixes #1547 

## What is being addressed

Resource processor should log the right output (stdout vs stderr).

## How is this addressed

- Fix the shell logging to output stdout on success
- Refactor our logging config/setup to better cope with local debugging and Application Insights
- Use a message scoped logger when one is already available
- Given the amount of testing done manually, upgrade all packages used to their latest version
- Increase the frequency of the RP pruning job as once a week isn't enough

'body': "Fixes #1547 

## What is being addressed

Resource processor should log the right output (stdout vs stderr).

## How is this addressed

- Fix the shell logging to output stdout on success
- Refactor our logging config/setup to better cope with local debugging and Application Insights
- Use a message scoped logger when one is already available
- Given the amount of testing done manually, upgrade all packages used to their latest version
- Increase the frequency of the RP pruning job as once a week isn't enough

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1582.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1582.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Fixes #1581 

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Fix the default value of the image tag bundle parameter to match the value in the version.txt file which determines the pushed image tag
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Fix the default value of the image tag bundle parameter to match the value in the version.txt file which determines the pushed image tag
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Fix the default value of the image tag bundle parameter to match the value in the version.txt file which determines the pushed image tag
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1582.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1582.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Fixes #1581 

## What is being addressed

The Guacamole workspace service bundle referred to an image tag that didn't exist.

## How is this addressed

- Fix the default value of the image tag bundle parameter to match the value in the version.txt file which determines the pushed image tag
- Add folders to the bundle dockerignore file that aren't required for the bundle installer. This saves ~300 MB in its size.
- Upgrade Terraform version used in the bundle.

'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1548.diff', 'patch_url': 'https://github.com/microsoft/AzureTRE/pull/1548.patch', 'merged_at': None}, 'body': "Fixes #1547 

## What is being addressed

Resource processor should log the right output (stdout vs stderr).

## How is this addressed

- Fix the shell logging to output stdout on success
- Refactor our logging config/setup to better cope with local debugging and Application Insights
- Use a message scoped logger when one is already available
- Given the amount of testing done manually, upgrade all packages used to their latest version
- Increase the frequency of the RP pruning job as once a week isn't enough

- Add the PR's _updatedAt_ date in case we don't find a commit (happens when the ref is from a fork)
- Add activity check to native branches as well
